intro: Hymenostephium hintonii, commonly known as the Hinton's hymenostephium, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
